page.title: 03CROFTING WITH SHEEP
page.content:
SHEEP ARE SUITABLE FOR SCORAIG BECAUSE THEY ARE HARDY.THEY ARE KEPT FOR WOOL, LAMBS AND MEAT. IN NOVEMBER TUPS ARE HIRED FROM THE DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE AND RUN WITH THE EWES UNTIL JANUARY.LAMBING TAKES PLACE ON THE CROFTS IN APRIL.AFTER THE LAMBS ARE MARKED THE SHEEP ARE USUALLY PUT BACK ON THE HILL UNTIL SHEARING IN JULY. IN SEPTEMBER THE LAMBS TO BE SOLD ARE WALKED BY THE CLIFF PATH TO DUNDONNELL 12 MILES AWAY AND TAKEN BY LORRY TO THE DINGWALL MARKET. THE EWE LAMBS ARE KEPT TO BUILD UP STOCK.
THE SHEEP ARE DIPPED TWICE A YEAR.
